Joel is a 30-year-old businessman, who lives in Juba Yei. He is married with 1 child, age of 3 months, who does not go to school. 

Joel runs a clinic store business. He has been in the business for 8 years and has 1 employee. Joel heard about Finance South Sudan from a radio advert. He is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more items like general drugs and many others. In addition to this business, Joel is a farmer; he grows the food that he is selling as his other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Joel would like to hope for better support from Finance Sudan so that he can have a better business to be expanded. His major challenges include low income rate and government plans of relocating the market.

Joel says that he is very happy for Finance South Sudan, for good support and God bless the company to grow bigger and bigger.

loans.use: to purchase more items like general drugs and many others

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 10 to 15 years. He describes himself to be a principled man. He operates a Nissan and he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a busy town and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of fuel. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy Nissan spare parts. His business goal is to buy another Nissan to increase the mode of transportation.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es comerciante de ropa caballeros y niños, vive con su esposa en casa de la suegra, tiene dos años de estar en el negocio, lo realiza de forma ambulante y su esposa le ayuda a atenderlo.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, ropa para niños, el préstamo le ayudara además a mejorar la disponibilidad y poder tener más mercadería, así sus ventas y ganancias. 
La aspiración de Julio es que a través del negocio ir arreglando poco a poco la vivienda que actualmente está construida de lamina.
texts.en:
Julio sells men’s and children’s clothing. He lives with his wife in his mother-in-law’s house. He has been in this business for two years. He is a door-to-door salesman and his wife helps him attend to the business. 

This loan will be for the purchase of pants, shirts, underwear, and children’s clothes.  The loan will also help him improve what is available and to be able to have more merchandise, and that way have greater sales and earnings.

Julio’s dream is that through the business he will be able to fix up his house, which right now is made of sheet metal, little by little.

loans.use: To purchase pants, shirts, underwear, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Manale

texts.en: Manale is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two school-age children. She cooperates with her husband in order to satisfy their family needs. Manale started to work as a tailor from her home in 2007 after having many years of experience in this domain. As for her husband, he has been serving in the Lebanese army since 1996. Today, she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new tailoring machine, which will allow her to increase her production and therefore her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en: Khadijeh is a 39-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children, who are still attending school. In 2006, she decided to start her own home business and support her husband with the heavy costs of life. She has been working in the agricultural field, specializing in installing plastic tents, and has the ambition to grow up and succeed in this domain. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new inventory such as pesticides and seeds for her lands in addition to plastic tents. In the future, she plans to open her own agricultural supplies shop.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory such as pesticides and seeds for her lands, in addition to plastic tents

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María Concepción, de 22 años, es soltera tiene una hija y vive con su hermana y la hija en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Arte y Cultura  “Wari” se encuentra en la comunidad de Larkaloma a 45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

María se dedica a la producción de leche, queso y crianza de pollos, además al cultivo de papas, habas y arveja.

Solicita el crédito para comprar una ternera y así aumentar la producción de leche y poder adquirir algunos insumos  como fertilizantes, líquidos y mejorar sus cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hacen en Guaranda semanalmente.El sueño es poder tener un vehículo que sea propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  es el transporte.

En el tiempo libre le gusta tejer, y la época del año más esperada es el  carnaval.
texts.en:
María Concepción is 22 years old, single, and has one daughter.  She lives with her sister and her child in Guaranda, in Bolívar province.

The 'Wari' Art and Culture Community Bank is located in Larkaloma community, 45 minutes from the office.  It has 11 members.

María is a milk producer.  She also makes cheese, raises chickens and grows potatoes, beans and peas.  She is requesting this loan to buy a calf so that she can increase her milk production.  She will also acquire some supplies such as fertilizers and liquids with which to improve her crops.

María makes her purchases and sales in Guaranda every week.  Her dream is to own her own vehicle as the challenge she faces is transportation difficulties.

In her free time, María enjoys knitting.  The time of year she most looks forward to is Carnival time.

loans.use: to buy a calf and thereby increase her milk production.  She will also acquire some supplies such as fertilizers and liquids in order to improve her crops

loans.name: Téliépa

texts.fr:
Téliépa est une femme âgé(e) de 30 ans. Elle est célibataire et a un enfant de 04ans.
Téliépa travaille comme revendeuse de chaussures et habits  depuis 2009. Elle exerce seule son activité au marché et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le marché.
Téliépa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures et habits. Elle veut renforcer son activité et mieux s’occuper de son enfant.
texts.en:
Téliépa is 30 years old, and she is a single mother of a 4-year-old child. She has been working as a shoe and clothing reseller since 2009. She works alone at the market and she buys her merchandise in Lomé. Her main difficulty is the competition. 

Téliépa is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy shoes and clothing. She wants to strengthen her business and better provide for her child.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis tiene 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también es visitada por infinidad de turistas ya que allí se encuentra la “laguna de Huacachina”, un Oasis en medio del desierto con unas dunas hermosas, también es una ciudad donde hay mucha agricultura, en especial el cultivo de Algodón, uva y espárragos. Cuando dispone de tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos y también aprovechar para comer uno de sus platos favoritos. 

Con mucho entusiasmo luis trabaja en su negocio como chofer de taxi y también haciendo colectivo, el cual consiste en transitar por una ruta especifica e ir captando pasajeros que desean ir por algunos de los lugares de su ruta; el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y atiende alrededor de 30 clientes en el día, asimismo tiene una mototaxi la cual compro con mucho esfuerzo y en oportunidades la alquila con los cual tiene un pequeño ingreso; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es, muy amable y respetuoso con sus clientes y sobre todo porque se levanta muy temprano y como dice el dicho al que madruga Dios lo ayuda.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá realizar mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo, lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo más seguro para los clientes y podrá mejorar sus ingresos con lo cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando para poder realizar su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de transporte”.
texts.en:
Luis is 27 years old and lives in the city of Ica.  This city experiences hot weather year round and is visited by a large number of tourists as it is home to the 'Huacachina Lake', an oasis in the middle of the desert which has some beautiful dunes.  It is also a city where there is a lot of agriculture, particularly cotton, grape and asparagus cultivation.  When Luis has any free time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors and also eating one of his favorite dishes.

Luis puts a lot of enthusiasm into his business as a taxi driver.  He also works 'haciendo colectivo' which means that he drives on a specific route and picks up passengers who want to travel to any of the places on the route.  He works around 10 hours a day and serves around 30 customers a day.  He also has a motorcycle taxi that he bought with a lot of effort. He sometimes hires it out and this makes him a small amount of extra income.  Luis believes that his business is doing very well because he is very kind and respectful to his customers and, above all, because he gets up very early and, as the saying goes 'God helps him who gets up early' (the early bird catches the worm).

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to your help, he will be able to have his car repaired and serviced.  This means he will have a safer vehicle for his customers and will be able to improve his income.  This, in turn, means that he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue working so that he can fulfill his biggest dream: to own a transport company.

loans.use: to have his vehicle repaired and serviced

loans.name: Pedro Segundo

texts.es:
Pedro Segundo, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero tiene dos hijos y vive con uno de ellos en Guaranda, provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Arte y Cultura  “Wari” se encuentra en la comunidad de Larkaloma a 45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de papas, maíz, además a la crianza de pollos y cerdos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, semillas insumos, fertilizantes, líquidos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá salvar los cultivos de papas y maíz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente. 

El sueño es poder tener un vehículo que sea propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el transporte.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer música,  y las costumbres que más le gustan son las del carnaval.
texts.en:
Pedro Segundo is 30 years old, single, has 2 children, and lives with one of them in Guaranda, Bolivar province. He is a farmer who sows potatoes and corn and raises chickens and pigs.

His communal bank, “Arte y Cultura (Art & Culture) “Wari”, is located in Larkaloma community, some 45 minutes from our office, and is composed of 11 members. 

Pedro requests a loan to buy manure, seeds to plant, fertilizers, and liquids. The loan will help him save his potato and corn crops. His purchases and sales are made in Guaranda weekly.

Pedro's dream is to have a vehicle of his own. The biggest challenge he faces is transportation. In his free time Pedro likes to make music, and the customs he most enjoys are those of carnival.

loans.use: buy manure, seeds to plant, fertilizers, liquids, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sweaters, backpacks and embroidery.

loans.name: Barako

texts.en:
Barako is a 40-year-old married man. He has a son. He describes himself as a principled man. 

He operates a retail store where he sells snacks, eggs, etc., and also runs an M-pesa (mobile phone money transfer) service. He has been in this business for three years. His business is located along a busy street  and his primary customers are the public. He describes his biggest business challenge as high prices of snacks, eggs, drinks, etc. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more snacks, eggs, etc. Barako's dream and business goal is to run another M-pesa outlet within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his car from the inside and the outside in order to increase its safety features.

loans.name: Hadiyeh

texts.en:
Hadiyeh is a 49-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. They’re both cooperating together in order to have a respectable life. 

Hadiyeh has been working as a tailor for the past nine years from her home. She’s well known as a reputable person and has gained a fair number of customers from all over the neighboring villages. Her husband has been also working as a constructor for 14 years.  

Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a tailoring machine for her business. This Kiva loan will boost her productivity and thus her revenues. 

In the future, she plans to open her own evening dresses shop and expand her business outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine for her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, who are still attending school. 

He has owned a small mini-market in his town since 1990. He sells in his store all types of products such as bread, chocolates, flour, canned food, etc. In parallel, he has worked as a taxi driver since 2000 to earn more income and better support his family. 

Today, he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory of food provisions. He expects that his business will continue to grow in the coming years.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory of food provisions.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa, tiene 30 años  de edad es soltera, tiene 1 hijo y vive con su madre  en Guaranda provincia Bolívar.

La VRC Arte y Cultura  “Wari” se encuentra en la comunidad de Larkaloma a 45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios

María se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de papas, maíz, además a la crianza de pollos y cerdos, también se dedica a realizar tejidos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, semillas insumos, fertilizantes, líquidos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá salvar los cultivos de papas y maíz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada quince días.

El sueño es poder tener un vehículo  y casa  propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el transporte, la competencia y los intermediarios.

En sus momentos libres descansa y la época del año que más le gusta es la Navidad.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is 30 years old, single, and has 1 son. She lives with her mother in Guaranda, Bolivar province. Maria is a farmer and cultivates potatoes and corn. In addition, she raises chickens and pigs, and also does weaving.

Her communal bank, “Arte y Cultura (Art and Culture) 'Wari',” is located in Larkaloma community, some 45 minutes from our office. It is composed of 11 members.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy manure, seeds to plant, fertilizers, and liquids. With help from the loan she will be able to save her potato and corn crops. Her purchases and sales are made in Guaranda every 15 days.

Maria's dreams are to have a vehicle and a house of her own. The challenges she faces include transportation, competition, and the middle men. In her free time, she rests and the time of year she likes most is Christmas.

loans.use: buy manure, seeds to plant, fertilizers, and liquids.

loans.name: Segundo Feliciano

texts.es:
Segundo Feliciano, tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, tiene 1 hijo y vive con él, en Guaranda, provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Arte y Cultura  “Wari” se encuentra en la comunidad de Larkaloma a 45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de papas, maíz, además a la crianza de pollos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fungicidas y líquidos para la maleza, abonos orgánicos Con la ayuda del crédito podrá salvar los cultivos de papas y maíz e incrementar la crianza de sus animales. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada quince días.

El sueño es poder tener su casa propia y guiar a su hijo por un buen camino y conseguir que sea profesional.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son el transporte y la competencia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta  jugar vóley  y la costumbre que más le gusta es el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo Feliciano is 32 years old.  He is single, he has one son whom he lives with in Guaranda, a province of Bolívar.

The Art and Culture Communal Bank "Wari" is located in the community of Larkaloma , 45 minutes away from the head office.  It is made up of 11 members.

Segundo works in agriculture, growing potatoes and corn, and also raising chickens.

He is requesting the loan to purchase manure, fungicides and liquid weed-killer, and organic fertilizers.  With the help of the loan,he will be able to salvage his potato and corn crops and increase his poultry raising.  He makes his purchase and sales in Guaranda every other week.

His dream is to be able to have his own home, and to guide his son onto a good path and ensure that he becomes a professional.

The challenges that he faces are transportation and the competition.

In his free time, he enjoys playing volleyball, and the local custom that he most enjoys is the Carnival.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fungicides and liquid weedkiller, and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en:
Fiona lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. Fiona lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.   

Fiona has a business of selling chips. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. Fiona sells her products door to door, by means of retail.  

Fiona has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.     

The main business challenges for Fiona include defaulters and thieves. Her goals are to build her own home and to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Assaad Naser

texts.en:
Assaad Naser is a 39-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married, living with his wife and five children, who are all studying. Assaad Naser is working really hard to improve his family’s life and allow them to spend the rest of it in a proper way. 

He has been working in selling construction tools since 1992, and he knows very well how to please and satisfy his clients. He also owns a truck in which he can transport his tools easily. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added construction supplies for his business. He notes that this will enhance his work and increase his earnings as well. 

In the future, he plans to develop his business more and hire someone to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase added construction supplies for his business.

loans.name: Sawodatou

texts.fr:
Sawadatou est une femme âgé(e) de 47 ans. Elle est mariée å un  militaire retraité. Elle a 05 enfants.
Sawadatou travaille comme revendeuse des produits vivriers depuis 1995. Elle vend à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Sawadatou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits vivriers(ignames , maïs, huile, boite de conserve et autre. Elle désire voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Sawadatou is a 47-year-old woman. She is married to a retired soldier. She has five children.

Sawadatou has been working selling foodstuffs since 1995. She sells from her home and stocks up in Lomé.

Sawadatou sought her first loan through WAGES in order to buy food products (yams, corn, oil, canned food, etc). She wants her children to grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy general food products and grains

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme  âgé(e) de 46 ans. Elle est mariée å un  infirmier.  Elle a 04 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 30 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.  
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse de friperies. Elle vend à la maison et dans les marchés de l’intérieur.
Akouvi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bals de friperies.  Elle désire acheter une voiture pour assurer le transport des marchandises et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a 46-year old woman. She is married to a nurse, and has four children, one of whom is in school. Her first child is 30, and the youngest is 18.  
Akouvi sells used clothes. She sells from home and in the countryside markets.

Akouvi has obtained her first loan from WAGES in order to buy bundles of used clothes.  She wants to buy a car to transport her merchandise, and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Jaime Oswaldo

texts.es:
Jaime  Oswaldo Guaquipana Chacha, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres, vive en Guaranda , provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Arte y Cultura  “Wari” se encuentra en la comunidad de Larkaloma a 45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios

Jaime se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de papas, maíz, además le gusta hacer música que rescata su identidad.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, fungicidas y líquidos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá salvar los cultivos de papas y maíz, además desea comprar un instrumento musical y mejorar la calidad de un grupo musical que posee. Las compras y las ventas lo realizan en diferentes partes de la provincia  y del país dependiendo de la necesidad.

El sueño es tener un propio estudio y equipos para grabar, en los tiempos libres compone canciones y la ápoca del año que más le gusta es el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Jaime Oswaldo Guaquipana Chacha is 25 years old, legally single, and lives with his parents in Guaranda, a province of Bolívar. 

The communal bank “Wari Art and Culture” can be found in the community of Larkaloma, 45 minutes from the office. It is made up of 11 members.
Jaime makes a living in agriculture planting potatoes and corn. On top of this, he likes to make music that expresses his personality.

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer, fungicides, and liquids. With the help of the loan he can save his potato and corn crops. On top of this, he wants to buy a musical instrument and improve the quality of a musical group he has. He buys and sells in different parts of the province and country, depending on what he needs.

His dream is to have his own studio and equipment for recording. In his free time he composes songs, and the time of year he likes best is Carnival.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer, fungicides, and liquids.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is twenty-eight years old. He lives in a small village in the Samegrelo Region, West Georiga with his family: wife – Rusudan, three children (seven, five and two years old) and parents. The family gets social assistance from the government, as a family living under the poverty line. Revaz works as worker in the village. Also they have one hundred nut trees on a family-owned plot of the land and they sell this product on the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 430 Laris, including social assistance and the pension of Revaz’s mother. 

Revaz has requested credit to start-up a dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Revaz will start up a dairy farm. He will purchase two milk cows. The cows will be placed in an old cattle-shed, located in Revaz’s yard. Revaz will get on average twenty litres of milk from each cow. He will produce dairy products – mainly cheese and yogurt and sell them on a local open market. The average monthly income of the family will increase by 300 Laris. Ramaz will be able to improve the living conditions of his children and his other family members as well.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 21 years old. She lives in a small village in the Akhmeta District, East Georgia. Madona lives with her family: parents and 29-year-old brother David. Madona works as a nurse in the village. She gets 180 Laris per month and it is the only source of the income for the family. Based on Credo estimations, the family belongs to village poor category.  

Madona’s brother used to have a car and he used it for transportation of wood from the forest. He was selling wood in his and nearby villages and earning more than half of the total monthly family income. His car was damaged a month ago, David sold it and stopped the business activities. 

Madona requested credit to purchase a car for David. David will use the car for transporting wood from the forest. Wood will be sold in nearby villages and the family will get additional income. Their living conditions will significantly improve. 

Madona’s loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. The received credit will allow the family to start a new business, which will give additional income to the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car to transport firewood

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de verduras y mariscos, ella vive en casa alquilada, desde hace 9 años, sus hijos viven con ella; el negocio de Ana es que su negocio cuente con lo necesario en verduras frescas y mariscos, ya que se ha mantenido en el mercado por ofrecer buenos productos, tiene 8 años de estar dedicada al negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo porque necesita invertir en el negocio comprando mercadería (verduras) y tambien pagar la prima de un lote que está adquiriendo, esta compra le ayudara para tener en el negocio lo necesario y además asegurar un terreno donde espera algún día vivir. 
La aspiración de Ana es poder con su negocio y los prestamos, finalizar el pago del lote y tener la oportunidad de construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ana's business is selling vegetables and seafood.  She has been living in a rental house for nine years.  Her children live with her.  Ana's business offers everything people need in fresh vegetables and seafood.  She has stayed in the market by offering good products.  She has been in this business for eight years.

Ana is requesting a loan because she needs to invest in her business by purchasing merchandise (vegetables).  She will also make a down payment on a plot of land that she is acquiring.  This purchase will help her to have what she needs for her business and guarantee a plot of land where she hopes to live some day.  Ana's aspiration is to be able, through her business and loans, to finish paying for her plot of land and have the opportunity to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and make a down payment on a plot of land

loans.name: Daniela Maritza

texts.es:
Daniela es una mujer de 19 años, se destaca por ser una persona sociable, buena, amigable, sincera y responsable en su trabajo. Daniela vive con sus padres en Salcedo que se encuentra a diez minutos de Latacunga en la Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Daniela trabaja sola en la crianza de cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos, negocio que le ayuda a apoyar a sus padres en los gastos de las necesidades de su casa. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de balanceado para alimentación de los cerdos, con esto sus cerdos engordaran y podrán ser vendidos en las ferias libres y obtendrá mejores ingresos para apoyar a sus padres y seguir sustentando sus estudios.

Daniela sueña dedicarse a la crianza de vacas y ganzos.
texts.en: Daniela is a 19 year old woman who stands out by being a sociable, friendly, good, sincere and responsible person in her work.  Daniela lives with her parents in Salcedo, which is located 10 minutes from Latacunga in the Cotoxi Province.  Daniela works alone raising pigs, fattening them up and selling them, a business that helps her support her parents with household costs.  This is the first loan that she has requested from Fodemi, and it will be invested in the purchase of feed for her pigs.  With the new feed her pigs will fatten up and they will be able to be sold at the market and will fetch a higher price.  This will help her support her parents and continue paying for her studies.  Daniela also dreams of making a living raising cows and geese.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs, in order to fatten them up and sell them.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli lives in a small village in the Tetritskaro district of East Georgia. She is 53 years old, married and lives with her family: husband Murman and three sons (20, 18 and 13 years old). The youngest of her children goes to school.  The eldest son and Murman work as workers in the village. 

Nanuli works as a saleslady in a village store and gets a monthly salary.  Along with her job, Nanuli is busy with the family dairy farm. She has 2 milk cows. Nanuli produces cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product per month in the open market of a nearby town. The total average monthly income for her family is 775 Laris.

Nanuli requested credit to purchase a milk cow.  With three milk cows, she will be able to increase the production and sales of cheese by 50%.  This will increase the income for the family by 150 to 180 Laris. The family will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 45 years old. He lives in a small village in the Mtskheta district with his familly — his wife Mzia,  three children (8, 5 and 2 years old) and his mother (retired). The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have a milk cow, 2 calves, 6 pigs and 30 hens in the family farm. Mzia produces dairy products (yogurt and cheese). The family sells dairy products, piglets (on average 50 per month) and eggs in the village to grocery products retailers. The total average monthly income for the family is 500 Laris, including the pension of Shalva’s mother. 

Shalva requested credit to purchase a milk cow.  Mzia will be able to double the amount of dairy products produced and sold. The income of the family will increase by 150 to 180 Laris.  Also, part of the credit will be used for the cultivation of the family-owned plot of the land where Shalva and Mzia will grow various vegetables. They will sell the harvested vegetables locally to greengrocery retailers and get additional income. With the increased income,  the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and pay for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Pastora María

texts.es:
Pastora es una mujer honrada, responsable y muy trabajadora, tiene 52 años. Pastora vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra que se encuentra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Pastora trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de chanchos, negocio que para ellos es indispensable ya que es su única fuente de ingresos económicos. Es la primera vez que solicita ún crédito a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de crías de chanchos para engorde y crianza, negocio que ayudará a tener chanchos grandes y podrá sacarlos a vender.

Pastora sueña con tener más animalitos para criarlos.
texts.en:
Pastora is an honourable, responsible and hard working 52 year old. Pastora lives with her husband and her children in the city of Ibarra that’s in the province of Imbabura.

Pastora and her husband are in the pig breeding business. For them, it’s indispensible as it’s the only source of income they have. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from Fodemi. This loan will be used to buy piglets to fatten and breed, a business that will allow them to raise big pigs and take them out to sell. 

Pastora dreams of having more animals to breed.

loans.use: buy piglets to fatten and breed.

loans.name: Rosa Catalina

texts.es:
Rosa, quiere comprar más producto como leña y maíz para la venta de las tortillas por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo con el cual espera mejorar y seguir incrementando su negocio. 
Ella considera que ha crecido en clientes por el apoyo de los préstamos anteriores además que a generado mayor estabilidad económica para su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa wants to purchase more products, like corn and firewood for her tortilla sales. She’s requesting a new loan to improve and continue expanding her business.
She believes that the loans she received previously have helped her to increase the number of her clients and maintain economic stability for her household.

loans.use: buy more products, like corn and firewood.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sister and father).  Sarah has a three year old business selling popcorn door to door.  Sarah works 7 days a week.  

Sarah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of maize and cooking oil.  She also generates additional income by selling charcoal.  Her main business challenges include defaulters and thieves.  

Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to get a permanent business premise.  Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize and cooking oil.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
44-year-old Magnolia is a married woman with 4 children, ages 19, 15, 12 and 5. Her husband runs a key duplicating business.

Magnolia is a coconut wine distributor. She buys from her trusted supplier then delivers to her regular customers. Magnolia earns 3500 PHP with this business. She requested a loan to buy more coconut wine to sell and blank keys. Magnolia hopes that through this loan, her business will be more profitable. She hopes to renovate their house and send all her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell and blank keys for her husband's key duplicating business

loans.name: Mediko

texts.en:
Mediko is 60 years old.  She lives in a small village in the Gori district with her husband Omar.  Mediko and Omar own a small dairy farm with two milk cows.  Mediko produces cheese and sells products to local dairy retailers.  They owns 1.5 hectare land where wheat, cabbage and tomatoes are grown.  Harvested products are sold locally to green grocery products retailers. Their average monthly income is 650 Laris. 

Mediko requested credit to finance seasonal agricultural works.  Mediko and Omar will purchase fuel for their tractor to till the land.  Also credit will be used to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and drugs for treating the plants from parasites.  They hope that the weather conditions will be favorable as well and the family will get a good harvest this summer.  They will sell the harvest through already known distribution channels and generate income, part of which will be reinvested in the business and the other part will be used to fund their family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and drugs for treating the plants from parasites.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol sells fish for a living. She helps her husband, a fisherman, sell fresh fish at the market. She buys more from other fishermen so they can sell more at the market. Mirasol also makes dried fish to sell to her neighborhood.

Mirasol works hard for her family. She hopes that her 7 children, who are between ages 14 and 25, will all have a proper education and a bright future.

Mirasol has applied for a loan to purchase fishing nets and more fish to sell. This will help improve Mirasol's business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and more fish to sell

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en:
Nawale is a 43 year-old Lebanese, married woman, with three school-aged children. 

She has sold clothes from her home since 2008 and has gained a fair number of customers.  As for her husband, he's worked for a local company many years. 

Today, Nawale’s requesting a loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added clothes, such as dresses, pants and other items.  She notes that this loan will certainly push her to get higher profits.  In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase added clothes, such as dresses, pants and other items.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken is 46 years old. He lives in a village in the Akhalkalaki District in the southern part of the country. Babken is married and lives with his family: wife Grachik, three sons (24, 23 and 17 years old), daughter in law and father (retired). Babken heads the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for the family. In particular, the family runs a small dairy farm with 5 milk cows. He produces cheese and sells it in the village and inTbilisi (capital city of the country). Also the family owns plot of the land, where barley is grown. Babken sells barley in the village. Grachik is busy with trade. She purchases clothing and kitchen utensils in the  wholesale market in Tbilisi and sells them in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 1100 Laris ($675), including the monthly pension of Babken’s father. 

Babken has a loan to purchase additional clothing and kitchen utensils for Grachik’s business. Grachik will diversify the assortment of products for sale and attract additional customers. Her sales will increase and the profit will  increase the total monthly income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en: Nilo is a 51-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is a fisherman. Nilo catches fish to sell to his community. He also farms seaweed to sell. Nilo works hard to improve his income of 4000 PHP per month. He applied for a loan to purchase seaweed and fishing nets. Nilo hopes to elevate his family's standard of living. He also dreams for his children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed and fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like, creams, hand and body lotions and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of the new summer clothing.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a 40-year-old married woman with 3 children ages 19, 17, and 14. Her husband works as a farmer.

Remedios started her sari-sari store 4 years ago. She sells items like coffee, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods, and other items that people in her community regularly buy from her. Remedios earns about 6,000 PHP per month with her business. She is happy that she is helping her husband provide for their family's needs and send their children to school.

Remedios has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as snacks and canned goods. Remedios hopes this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as snacks and canned goods

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past seven years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increase more capital into her business. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 42 years old, married, and has a 15-year-old child. She lives on the island of Maomawan in Bien Unido, Bohol. Sabina has been in the fishing business for 11 years. Her husband is a fisherman.

Sabina sells her husband's catch at the market. Aside from fresh fish, she also sells crabs. Sabina requested a loan to purchase crab traps, fishing nets, floaters, and lead for fishing weights. She hopes to earn more and be able to purchase another fishing boat. She also hopes to sustain her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase crab traps, fishing nets, floaters, and lead for fishing weights

loans.name: Ana Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Ana, necesita comprar más productos para surtir el negocio comprando arroz, aceite, azúcar, huevos, queso, que le permita mejorar y crecer el inventario.
Ella considera que con el préstamo anterior a cambiado las condiciones del negocio siendo más rentable y dándole mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana needs to purchase more products to stock her business with rice, oil, sugar, eggs and cheese, which will allow her to improve and grow her inventory.  She knows that with the previous loan she received, the condition of her business has changed for the better, becoming more profitable and giving her higher earnings.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar, eggs and cheese.

loans.name: Shafik

texts.en:
Shafik is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom currently attends school. For the past six years, Shafik has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells hardware materials. 

To help expand his business, Shafik has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hardware materials for resale, and will help Shafik to generate greater profits and increase the capital in his business. Shafik hopes that in the future he will be able to have a very big business.

Shafik is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shafik who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase hardware materials for resale

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
Servando is a 41-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has six children, the oldest of whom is 22 years old.

Servando has been working as a fisherman for quite some time now. He earns about 4,800 PHP per month doing this fishing. He requested a loan to purchase nylon, fishing nets, and gasoline for the boat. Servando hopes to earn more and be able to send all his children to school. He also hopes to elevate his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase nylon, fishing nets, and gasoline for the boat

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 35 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past eight years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her inventory of charcoal, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and buy family needs like food. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to become a powerful business woman. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase her charcoal inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past 10 years, Esther has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities for her business, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and change her children's lives into better ones. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to become a powerful business woman. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Esther who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities for her business

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa Estela recently opened a new restaurant to supplement her clothing and electronic goods business. She is 43 years old and married with three children who are 12, 20, and 22. In the photo, she is pictured with her granddaughter. For a number of years, Rosa Estela has purchased clothing and electronic goods from the border between Chile and Peru, and brought them to Cusco where she sells them. 

Currently, she is focusing on her new restaurant, and is requesting a loan in order to buy tables and large pots, and add another kitchen. The restaurant serves typical Peruvian food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Rosa Estela would like to open another location and thereby grow her business into a chain of restaurants. 

Rosa Estela is a member of the village bank "Prosperidad" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Rosa Estela recently opened a new restaurant to supplement her clothing and electronic goods business. She is 43 years old and married with three children who are 12, 20, and 22. In the photo, she is pictured with her granddaughter. For a number of years, Rosa Estela has purchased clothing and electronic goods from the border between Chile and Peru, and brought them to Cusco where she sells them. 

Currently, she is focusing on her new restaurant, and is requesting a loan in order to buy tables and large pots, and add another kitchen. The restaurant serves typical Peruvian food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Rosa Estela would like to open another location and thereby grow her business into a chain of restaurants. 

Rosa Estela is a member of the village bank "Prosperidad" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy tables and large pots, and add another kitchen to her restaurant

loans.name: Amanecer De Los Inkas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Amanecer de los Inkas” está conformado por seis varones y cinco mujeres. La mayoría de los socios son amigos, compañeros de trabajo y vecinos que tienen una buena amistad. Los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico, sus paisajes, su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país. 

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo venta de comestibles, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de artesanía, venta de cerveza y otros brindan servicios. 

La socia Lourdes tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y fruto esta unión tienen tres hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica de  Lourdes es la venta de comestibles y tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Lourdes requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. Ella compra al por mayor sus productos pues le sale más barato y por lo tanto la tienda esta surtida de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: The community bank "Amanecer de los Inkas" (Dawn of the Incas) consists of six men and five women.  The majority of the members are friends, workmates and neighbors that have a close friendship together.  The members live in the city of Cusco, a city which is characterized by its archeological centers, its historical center, its landscapes, its history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of Peru.  The members are workers and entrepreneurs that at all times are searching for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily effort to be able to offer a better future to their children.  The majority of the members make a living in different businesses, such as selling groceries, selling vegetables, selling prepared food, selling artisan crafts, selling beer others work in the service industry.  Lourdes, a 33 year old member, is married and has three children, was born in the province of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born.  Lourdes' business is the sale of groceries and she has a small store in her home.  At this time, Lourdes requires a loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her store, such as sacks of rice and sugar and other supplies.  She purchases her products wholesale seeing as it is more economical, and as a result of these purchases, the store is stocked with staple products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar as well as other supplies.

loans.name: Munay Soncco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal MUNAY  SONCCO; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Eduardina tiene 22 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros, a la vez la socia se dedica  al negocio de venta de comida  ella ejerce este negocio solo en las mañanas en un mercado en la ciudad de Cusco y por las tardes atiende su tienda de abarrotes siendo su esposo quien le ayuda por las mañanas  en la tienda  de abarrotes mientras la socia vende la comida a sus clientes que le solicitan,  la socia es una persona empeñosa y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante día a día siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azucar, leche, golosinas,gaseosas entre otros.

Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de fruta, compra y venta de productos agrícolas, brindando  servico de taxi y urbano, panadería,tienda de abarrotes .

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Munay Soncco” communal bank located in Wanchaq District in Cusco Province and Cusco Department

Eduardina, 22, has a spouse and two children. She alternates her daily chores with a grocery store business; she sells various types of products like rice, sugar, milk, snacks and soft-drinks, among others.  At the same time she runs a food selling business but only in the morning in one of Cusco’s markets.  She tends to her grocery store in the afternoons and it’s her husband who looks after the store in the morning while she’s selling the food her customers request.  She is a very dedicated, responsible person who very much wants to get ahead day to day since this is the way she moves her family ahead.  She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise for her store like rice, sugar, milk, snacks and soft-drinks, among others.

The other group members are fruit merchants, farm products merchants, provide urban taxi service, bakery and grocery store.

She is grateful for this means of getting credit and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik is 52 years old and lives with his wife Narine, a 25-year-old daughter, and 22-year-old son. He lives in Ninotsminda District, Southern part of Georgia. Norik mainly works on renovation projects in his district. Narine works as a milkmaid in a local farm. 

Along with their main jobs, the family runs a small scale agricultural business. They grow potatoes on a family owned plot of land. Norik sells harvested potatoes locally to grocery wholesalers. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Laris.

Norik requested a loan to purchase potatoes for sowing. He will purchase a better quality of potatoes than he grew before. Narine and Norik will work hard during the spring and summer to get a good harvest in early summer. They hope to increase income to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing on his farm land.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 51 years old and is married with 7 children ranging from ages 10 to 24 years old. She earns a living by selling bread to her community.

Rizalina and her husband work together in their bread business. They bake the bread and use their motorcycle to deliver bread to their customers. 
Rizalina does her best to sell quality bread to her community.

She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients like flour and sugar for making the bread, and to use for motorcycle maintenance to deliver the bread. Rizalina hopes to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour and sugar to make bread for her business, and to maintain her motorcycle so she can deliver the bread.

loans.name: Zarah

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Zarah. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 10. In 2005, Zarah established her business selling clothing, bags, and shoes. She began her business to be able to provide for her family's needs. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,300,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy cotton dresses, low-heeled slippers, ladies bags, and blouses. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Zarah plans to increase the size of the shop and accommodate more customers and inventory. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cotton dresses, low-heeled slippers, ladies bags, and blouses

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Deysi; ella es conviviente y tiene 24 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de pollo y pescado, ella envía estos productos a lugares como Puerto Maldonado, ella envía en su propio camión, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos y pescados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollo y pescados al por mayor.
Los dos socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo,es por eso que no estuvieron en la reunion.

 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de vidrios, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de  venta de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Deysi, 24, has a spouse and two children.  She works selling chicken and fish.  She sends these products to places like Puerto Maldonado in her own truck.  She supports her children through this business.  Her dream is to own a locale where she can sell chicken and fish. She’s asking for the loan to buy chicken and fish at wholesale.

The two members stuck to the group photo requested permission due to work and that’s why they weren’t at the meeting.

The other members sell glass, crafts, groceries and clothes.

The members thank those who participate in this dream through this means and commits to make her installment payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy chicken and fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es: Martha Maria tiene 25 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería ya tiene años de tenerla, este negocio lo inicia con fondos propios y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha salido adelante con sus dos hijos que todavía está a su cargo y están estudiando. M	artha Maria está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos y brindarle a sus clientes variedad de productos lo cual compara granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevos, jabón, pan, azúcar, entre otros productos que más demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha María, 25, has a grocery store; she’s had it for years.  She started the business with her own funds and with much effort and dedication has gotten ahead with her two children who are still in her care and attending school.

Martha María is asking for financing to buy merchandise and provide her customers with a variety of products.  She will buy basic grains, rice, beans, oil, eggs, soap, bread and sugar among other products her customers request.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Erick Francisco

texts.es:
Erick Francisco  vive en compañía de su mamá en su casa propia,  es un joven que se dedica a la  enseñanza a  niños  de dicho municipio. Actualmente está pasando dificultades ya que su humilde casa se encuentra en   malas  condiciones. Tuvo la oportunidad  a través de sus amistades de  informarse que Ceprodel apoya  a estas personas  a mejorar su  calidad de vida.

Se presentó por primera vez para solicitar un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, y zinc. Estos  materiales de construcción los necesitan con urgencia para poder reparar su vivienda,  Espera en nuestra institución que le brinde esta  ayuda,  y este  sea otorgado para así iniciar su obra, y alcanzar su meta de tener un techo digno y seguro para  su familia.
texts.en:
Erick Francisco lives with his mom in his own home.  He is a young man whose job is teaching children in the town where he lives.  He is currently experiencing some difficulties because his humble home is in a bad state of repair.  He found out that Ceprodel support people in improving their quality of life through some friends.

Erick Francisco came to Ceprodel for the first time to request a loan so that he could buy cement, sand and metal sheets.  He needs these building supplies urgently in order to repair his home.  He hopes that our institution will help him and that he will receive a loan so that he can start his work and achieve his goal of having a safe and decent home for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and metal sheets

loans.name: Rita Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rita es una mujer de 52 años, es una persona muy amigable, muy feliz y muy trabajadora. Rita vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Rita trabaja sola en la elaboración de tejidos de lanas como sacos, es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito va a invertir en la compra de lana al por mayor, ya que necesita incrementar su producción para mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Rita sueña en contratar tejedoras y ponerse un taller grande para distribuir en grande.
texts.en:
Rita is a very friendly, happy and very hardworking, 52 year old woman.  Rita lives with her husband and three children in the city of Ibarra, Imbabura Province.

Rita works knitting woolen items like coats.  This is the first time she’s worked with Fodemi and will use the loan to buy wool yarn at wholesale because she needs to increase production in order to improve income and quality of life.

Rita dreams with hiring knitters and installing a large workshop so that she can sell in large scale.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn at wholesale.

loans.name: Leydin Karina

texts.es:
Leydin Karina habitante del Sauce, actualmente  desempeña el cargo de cajera, es madre de un niño el cual depende de ella, es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación, espíritu emprendedor, tuvo la oportunidad de conocer un poco acerca de  Ceprodel. El apoyo que el brinda a personas que tienen la necesidad de medicinas para mejorar su salud.

Por esta razón  se presentó a nuestra institución para solicitar un crédito, para la compra de medicamentos,  ya que no esta a su alcance adquirir completamente el tratamiento para  combatir sus enfermedades, ya que  ha estado un poquito mal. Lo que mas anhela es gozar de buena salud para seguir cuidando de su hijo y salir adelante. El apoyo que espera la  motiva a seguir luchando para lograr vivir en una vida más saludable
texts.en:
Leydin Karina lives in El Sauce and currently works as a cashier.  She is the mother of one son who is still dependent on her.  Leydin is a woman who has a great desire to do well in life and she has an enterprising spirit.  She had the opportunity of finding out a little bit about Ceprodel and the support that they give people who need medicines in order to improve their health.

For this reason, Leydin came to our institution to request a loan with which to buy medicines.  She is not able to acquire all of the medicines she needs to fight her illnesses.  She has been a little sick.  What she most wishes for is to enjoy good health so that she can continue caring for her son and making progress in life.  The support that she hopes for encourages her to continue working hard so that she can manage to live a more healthy life.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 38 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 7 years, Milly has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, and other goods. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock, which will help Milly to generate greater profits and improve the quality of her life. Milly hopes that in the future she will be become self reliant and live a good life. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Milly who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa la cual lo apoya en todo lo que el emprende, juntos tienen 6 hijos y su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas, además de ser conocida como la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, además de ser conocida por la  buena sazón que tienen sus pobladores para la preparación de platillos, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”.

Con mucha dedicación Humberto se dedica a su negocio como albañil, él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 9 horas al día, pero depende del tipo de construcción que el haga; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza un buen trabajo y tiene buenos acabados.

Humberto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una maquina mezcladora para cemento, con lo cual le permitirá tener una herramienta muy necesaria en su trabajo y así dar mejor servicio a sus cliente lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su sueño.” Tener contratos con empresas grandes”.
texts.en:
Humberto is 55 years old living with his wife who supports him in everything he does.  They have six children together and their house is located in the city of Chincha, a city noted for its hot climate, beautiful beaches and also for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes.  It’s also well known for its cuisine; its residents are known for preparing very tasty dishes and one of his favorites is the very delicious “Carapulcra con sopa seca” [pork with noodles].

With much dedication, Humberto works as a bricklayer.  He works about 9 hours per day depending on the type of construction job he has.  He believes that he does well in his business because he does good jobs with good finishings.

Humberto is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy a cement mixer which will allow him to have a very necessary work tool to provide better service to his customers which will make it possible for him to continue working and striving toward making his dream a reality: “To have contracts with large firms.”

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Joven Guadalupe actualmente se desempeña como Secretaria en un centro educativo ubicado en el Municipio del Sauce, es madre de dos hijos los cuales están bajo su cargo, ella tiene muchos deseos de superación por cual  motivo es que recurre a Ceprodel, que apoya a las personas a dar bienestar  a sus familias. 

Por esta razón  se presentó para solicitar un crédito, para la compra de electrodomésticos  (Televisor y un equipo de sonido),  para tener una  mejor calidad de  vida, con mucho esfuerzo lucha para salir adelante, impulsado con la esperanza que se le conceda el crédito, agradeciendo la oportunidad que le puedan brindar para cumplir  sus metas de vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Guadalupe currently works as a secretary in an educational center, in the town of El Sauce.  She is the mother of two children who are both in her care.  She has a great desire to do well in life and so she came to Ceprodel who support people who want to provide for their familys' well-being.

Guadalupe came to request a loan in order to buy some electrical appliances (a television set and some sound equipment) so that she can enjoy a better quality of life.  She works very hard to make progress in life and is encouraged by the hope that she will receive a loan.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she may be given to achieve her goal of living in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances

loans.name: Kuska Llankasun De Rumichaca Baja Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca Baja” está conformado por cinco varones y nueve mujeres. La mayoría de los socios son amigos, compañeros de trabajo y vecinos que tienen una buena amistad. Los socios viven en la ciudad de Urubamba en la asociación pro vivienda de Cotowincho.

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  La mayoría de los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como crianza de animales menores, cosméticos, venta de verduras, venta de artesanía, comestibles y otros brindan servicios. 

La socia Yanet tiene 27 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica de Yanet es la compra y venta de animales menores como cuyes. Yanet y su esposo se dedican también a la fabricación de muebles de madera como sillas, mesas, camas, puertas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Yanet requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo madera. 

(La  socia que no aparece en la fotografía pidiò permiso a la junta directiva para no estar presente en la reunión).
texts.en:
The “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca Baja” communal bank is made up of five men and nine women.  Most of the members are friends, coworkers, and neighbors with a good relationship.  They live in the Cotowincho settlement of Urubamba.

The members are hardworking, enterprising, and in search of opportunities to get ahead and provide a better future for their children through their daily efforts.  Most of the members have different businesses, such as raising livestock, cosmetic sales, vegetable sales, arts and crafts, food, and other services.

Yanet is 27 years old; is in a live-in relationship and they have three children.  She was born in the Urubamba province and lives in the same city where she was born.  Yanet buys and sells small animals, such as Guinea pigs.  She and her husband also make wooden furniture, such as chairs, beds, doors, and other things.  Yanet needs this loan to buy supplies such as lumber.

(This member does not appear in the photograph.  She got permission from the board not to attend the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Señor Pan De Azucar De Sacllo Group

texts.es:
Sacllo está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los antiguos Inkas, Sacllo se caracteriza por tener zonas agrícolas y ganaderas, Un grupo de vecinas y amigas formaron hace varios años el banco comunal “Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo”, actualmente se encuentra en el XVI ciclo, el banco comunal está conformado por doce mujeres y un varón que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las comunidad de Sacllo. Las actividades económicas de los socias a las que se dedican son por ejemplo a la venta de verduras, venta de comestibles, venta de frutas, venta de chicha, venta de leche, venta de golosinas y venta de animales menores y un socio brinda servicio de docencia. 

Basilia forma parte del banco comunal, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Basilia nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que está sacando adelante a sus hijos sin ayuda de su pareja. Su actividad económica de Basilia es la venta de verduras, crianza de animales menores y venta de chicha de jora. En esta oportunidad Basilia requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores y semillas. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The community of Sacllo is in the district and province of Calca in the department of Cusco in the centre of the Valle Sagrado (Sacred Valley) of the Inkas. Sacllo is known as a farming region, livestock and agriculture. Years ago, a group of female friends formed the Communal Bank, “Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo” (God of Bread and Sugar of Sacllo) and now find themselves in their 16th loan cycle. This group is formed by 12 women and 1 man – all are hard-working entrepreneurs who search for opportunities to get ahead and with their everyday efforts, hope to offer their children a better future. All of the members live in Sacllo. The businesses of the members include vegetable sales, food sales, fruit sales, chicha (alcoholic drink made from fermented maize) sales, milk sales, candy sales and small animal sales, and one member offers teaching services.

Basilia, a member of the Communal Bank, is single and has 3 kids. Basilia tells us with much pride that that she is getting ahead with her children, without the help of her partner. Basilia sells vegetables, breeds small animals and sells chicha (alcoholic drink made from fermented maize) made from jora (specially-prepared maize). Basilia is requesting the loan to buy more small animals and seeds.

The members are grateful for the opportunity they have been given and promise to meet their payments on schedule.

loans.use: buy more small animals and seeds.

loans.name: Juana Lucelinda

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen  4 hijos, dos de ellos son mayores de edad y estudian en universidad, los menores son mellizos, tiene 10 años de edad y están en el último año de escuela. Su esposo es maestro de escuela. 

Ella es una muy buena esposa y ama de casa que además de atender su hogar también trabaja de maestra en una escuela local y se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas en la escuela y de tarde recorre por la localidad para ofrecer sus productos, ella les vende a sus compañeras de trabajo ya que son sus mejores clientes.  Deja a crédito y cobra los sabados o domingos cada semana, lleva más de 6 años dedicada a sus ventas y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar: ropa y productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de dos años y le gusta por la ayuda del grupo.
 
Sus metas son continuar con su negocio y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
In Manabí Province’s 24 de Mayo Canton known for its beautiful scenery, forests and variety of fauna and for its hardworking residents who are farmers and raise animals, the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For A Better Future) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

Juana, 42, lives here.  She’s married and has four children.  Two of them are adults and attend university and the younger ones are 10 year old twins attending the final year in elementary school.  Her husband is a school teacher.

She is a very good wife and housewife who besides tending to her home also works as a teacher in a local school.  She’s also a merchant selling clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics and women’s accessories).  She works every day at school in the morning and during the afternoon wanders through her locality selling her products.  She sells to fellow workers who are her best customers.  She sells on credit collecting payment on Saturday or Sunday each week.  She’s been in sales for more than 6 years and she does very well.

This loan is to buy clothes and Yanbal products.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than two years and likes it because of the group support.  Her goals are to continue with her business and to improve it.

loans.use: to buy clothes and Yambal brand products.

loans.name: Linda Phebe

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Linda. She is married, and has one child aged two. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to help with the household chores. In 2004, Linda established her fish business. She began her business because she wants to be self-sustaining. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about Le 1,400,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. 

Linda has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now needs a new loan in order to buy additional fish. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Linda plans to expand to other areas of the town. She thinks the loan can help her improve her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for fish.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Kadiatu. She is married, and has three children aged ten, six, and four. In 2000, Kadiatu established her cooking condiment business. She began her business to help her husband take care of their home. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. 

Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now needs a new loan to buy additional cooking condiments. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to own a shop, to educate her children to the university level, and to have more motor bikes as transport. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for maggi oil, rice, and seasonings.

loans.name: Edward T

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Edward. He is married, and has three children aged three, seven, and fourteen. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to help with the household chores. In 2009, Edward established his food and drinks business. He began his business because of the high profit earned in food and drinks. Working six days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. 

Edward has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now needs a new loan in order to increase his stock and improve the musical facilities. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Edward plans to secure another building in this business location. He is grateful to ARD for the support, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for food and drinks.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Lucia, tiene 49 de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor que en escuela. Ella vive sola con sus hijos.

Ella trabaja de empleada pública en el cuerpo de bomberos de 24 de mayo y también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa e interior, sobrecamas, toallas entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella recorre en las noches y los fines de semana  con la ayudan su hija.
