Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita,  lleva más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, pantalones, camisas y ropa interior para estudiantes ya que están por iniciar las clases y es cuando estos productos se venden más. Está en el Banco Comunal por más de 11 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio y está muy agradecida con la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran local y ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
In Manabí Province’s 24 de Mayo Canton known for its beautiful scenery, forests and variety of fauna and for its hardworking residents who are farmers and raise animals, the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For A Better Future) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

We met Lucia, 49, here.  She’s a single mother of two children who are 16 and 10 years old.  The older one attends secondary school and the younger one is in elementary school.  She lives alone with her children.

She’s a public employee in the 24 de Mayo fire department and is also a merchant; she sells clothes, underwear, bedspreads and towels, among others.  She sells door to door during evenings and on the weekend; her daughter helps her.  She sells on credit and collects payments every eight days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise whenever she needs to.  She’s been in this line of work for 11 years and does very well.

This loan is to buy sheets, pants, shirts and underwear for students since they are about to start classes and this is when these products sell best.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 11 years and likes it because she was able to start her business with her first loan and she’s very grateful to the institution.  Her dreams are to have a large store and to be a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy sheets, pants, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Sallieu

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Sallieu. He is married, and has three children aged fifteen, twelve, and nine. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to go to high school. In 1997, Sallieu established his used clothing business. He began his business because it was the only way he had to gain economic and financial freedom. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. 

Sallieu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy quality used clothing in the neighboring country Guinea. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Sallieu plans to build a house and to educate his children to higher level. With the loan, he hopes to increase his capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for building materials.

loans.name: Angelica Liliana

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
La señora Angélica tiene 37 años de edad, está divorciada, pero de esta relación tuvo dos hijos de 16 y 12 años de edad que estudian  en el colegio. 

Ella para salir adelante y para que a sus hijos nunca les faltara nada desde hace mas de 10 años se  dedica al comercio, vende productos de  Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas), ropa y zapatos por catálogos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local y hasta  donde sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00, vende a crédito y al contado. La ropa y los zapatos se los envían desde Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar: ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes y accesorios de damas. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace más de tres años y le gusta por la forma de trabajar en la institución.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Manabí Province’s 24 de Mayo Canton known for its beautiful scenery, forests and variety of fauna and for its hardworking residents who are farmers and raise animals, the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For A Better Future) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

Angélica is 37 years old, divorced and has two children who are 16 and 12 years old and attend secondary school.  In order to get ahead and so that her children would have everything they need she’s been a merchant for more than ten years.  She sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories), and clothes and shoes via catalogue.  She sells door to door and also from home where she has a small locale that her customers can visit.  She works every day from 8:30am until 4pm.  Her sales are cash and credit.  The clothes and shoes are shipped to her from Guayaquil.

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, creams, perfume and women’s accessories.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for more than three years and she likes it because of the way the institution operates.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, creams, perfume and women's accessories.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 17 años, en el municipio de Soledad, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene dos negocios, vende mercancía variada y también comidas; su idea de negocio ocurrió  desde hace 3 años, buscando la oportunidad de obtener ingresos suficientes para lograr cada vez mas su bienestar y el de su familia, hasta ese momento a cargo de su esposo. Su clientela que le compra alimentos, está ubicada en el barrio donde habita y la que le compra mercancías variadas en el centro del municipio de Soledad  y a ellos les vende  directamente  puerta a puerta.  Mientras sus compras las hace de contado, las ventas las hace a crédito, por eso su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para responderle a una nueva clientela y esto es justamente la razón pro la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancías variadas encargadas por sus clientes, inversión que tendrá éxito porque rotará rápidamente pues está en marcada en resolver sus necesidades de consumo.
texts.en: Maria lives with her spouse and three children, ages 10 and 17, in the town of Soledad, twenty minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  There she has two businesses; she sells assorted merchandise and also sells food.  She came up with the idea of starting the business three years ago. She was looking for the opportunity to earn enough income to increasingly improve her welfare and that of her family, which had been her husband’s responsibility up until that time. Customers who buy meals from her are located in the neighborhood where she lives, and she sells assorted merchandise door-to-door directly to customers in Soledad’s town center.  She makes her purchases in cash. However, she makes her sales on credit and consequently, her greatest challenge is to have the enough working capital in order to meet the demands of her new customers. This is exactly the reason she has come to Kiva to request her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy assorted merchandise to fill customer orders, and the investment will be successful because goods will rotate quickly since they are bought with customers’ needs in mind.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He has a daughter. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a restaurant where he sells tea, food, snacks, etc. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of food ingredients. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients. His business goal is to expand his business and venture into a wholesale retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals for selling.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
1.	Miriam es una señora de 48 años de edad y  vive con su familia, en la comunidad de Canalette, en la región de Upala, San Carlos en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta provincia ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas, una de las principales zonas ganaderas del país especialmente a través de la producción del cantón de San Carlos. Además en la provincia se asientan las plantas procesadoras de leche de la Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, propiedad de miles de productores de leche. Además en la zona alrededor de la ciudad de Alajuela se ha asentado gran cantidad de empresas manufactureras de exportación. En Alajuela operan las zonas francas de El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos y Bet. 

Desde hace algún tiempo se dedica a la ganadería,  su proyecto es la compra y venta de ganado de doble propósito, esto significa que compra los animales con bajo peso y los alimenta hasta que alcancen el peso suficiente para venderlos, e igualmente compra  ganado con el peso ideal y lo revende en las ferias ganaderas  de la zona.

Actualmente Miriam  está solicitando un micro crédito de un millón cincuenta mil colones (¢1.050.000)  para  continuar con este proyecto, con esto ella espera  seguir creciendo en su negocio y a la vez   mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Miriam es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 48 year old woman who lives with her family in the Canalette community in the Upala, San Carlos region, Alajuela province.  This province holds first place nationally for its coffee and sugarcane production.  It also produces basic grains (rice, beans, corn) fruit, vegetables, and tubers.  It is one of the primary areas for raising livestock in the country.  This is especially true due to the production in the San Carlos canton.  

Also, the province is the site of the milk processing plants for the Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, which belongs to thousands of milk producers.  Additionally, in the area around the city of Alajuela a great number of businesses that manufacture for export have been established.  In Alajuela the free zones operates in El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos, and Bet.

Miriam has been farming for some time.  She buys and sells livestock for two reasons.  This means that she buys the animals at a low weight, and then she feeds them until they gain enough weight to sell them.  Also, she buys livestock at their ideal rate and resells the cattle at the livestock fairs in the zone.

Miriam is requesting a small loan for one million and fifty thousand colones in order to continue with this project.  With the loan she hopes to continue growing in her business.  At the same time she hopes to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Miriam is a member the Canalette communal bank, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level.  She also plans to actively participate in loan organization in her community.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Celia Silfide

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Celia, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos todos mayores de edad, una hija vive en su casa la cual es madre soltera y vive con su pequeño hijo. El marido trabaja en el campo.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo el cual no gana mucho en el campo se dedica a la compra y venta de huevos, tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual realiza sus ventas, trabaja todos los días ya que es en su casa donde realiza esta actividad y no le causa ningún problema ya que realiza sus labores al tiempo que vende sus productos, ella lleva 4 años realizando esta labor la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco. 

Este crédito es para comprar huevos, fundas plásticas y cubetas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella puede ganar algo por su cuenta.
 
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y salud sobretodo.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the communal bank "San Esteban" meets every 15 days.  This is a place that is known for its traditional culture and also for being just minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Celia, 53, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage from which she has 4 children who are all adults.  One of her daughters lives in her house; she is a single mother and lives with her small child.  Celia's husband is a field worker.

In order to earn something on her own and thereby help her husband, who earns little working the fields, Celia has a business buying and selling eggs.  She has a small store in her house where she makes her sales.  She works every day, because her business is in her house and so this doesn't cause her any problems; she can do her household tasks at the same time that she is selling her products.  She has been doing this work for 4 years, and she started this business with the first loan that she received from this bank.

She will use this loan to buy eggs, plastic bags and buckets.  She has been with her communal bank for 4 years, and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she has been able to earn something on her own.

Her dreams are to have a bigger business and, most of all, to have good health.

loans.use: to buy eggs, plastic bags and buckets

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar  vive la señora María, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 20, 16 y 10 años  de edad, todos estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de fundas y embases de plástico en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja de jueves a domingos ya que es en estos días hay mas movimiento en el sector por cuanto son días de feria y salen las personas de los campos a surtirse de productos, trabaja desde las 8h0 hasta las 17h00 que cierra su negocio. Sus productos los va  a comprar a Guayaquil en una fábrica de plásticos. Lleva más de seis años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para ir a comprar fundas y envases plásticos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 16 años y  le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en todos estos años.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio y sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “San Esteban” (St. Stephen) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes away from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

María, 44, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are 20, 16 and 10 years old.  They all attend university, middle school and elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a business buying and selling plastic bags and containers in the center of the city.  She works Thursday to Sunday since these are the days with most commercial activity in the sector because they are market days and people from the countryside come by to stock up on merchandise.  She works from 8am until 5pm when she closes her business.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her products at a plastics factory.  She’s been in this business for more than six years and she does very well.

This loan is to buy plastic bags and containers.  She’s been in the communal bank for 16 years and likes it because of all the help she’s gotten over the years.  Her dream is to continue expanding the business and her sales.

loans.use: to buy bags and plastic containers.

loans.name: Avargasaihan

texts.en:
Avargasaihan is a 46-year-old man who lives with his wife and a son in the capital city of Mongolia. His son is employed. His wife is a retiree. He has been running a taxi service business since 2001. During these years, he has raised the family income significantly. 

He has been driving his van for 11 years. He is an experienced driver who has a further plan to expand the business, but now his van needs to be repaired. Avargasaihan is an honest and hardworking man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by having my car repaired so that I could continue my business successfully." The total amount he is requesting is 1,550,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Yanaway

texts.en:
Yanaway is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and she has 6 children between the ages of 20 and 29, all of whom are attending school and live at home.

For the past 20 years Yanaway has been selling rubber dishes (cups, plates, bowls) in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business. She plans to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (cups, plates, bowls) for her business.

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Batsuh is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and 3 children in the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife both run a taxi service. He earns 65 to 70 thousand MNT a day and the business has been successful. 

He runs a construction decoration job in the summertime. He needs to buy some construction materials and some tools for the business to continue. Batsuh is a hardworking man who says, "I would like to continue the business so that I could raise more money in the summertime and save for my children."

The total amount he is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy the construction decoration materials and tools.

loans.use: To buy construction decoration materials and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Isaura Esther

texts.es: La doctora Isaura Esther de 30 años de edad, labora como medico General desde hace 4 años, su esposo trabaja como administrador, ambos son bien trabajadores y comparten con los gastos del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos , solicita crèdito para comprar un solar que le permitira tener acceso a la luz en la zona donde vive,  segun referencias esta pareja se caracteriza por ser bien responsables,su mayor sueño en la vida gozar de estabilidad laboral y ayudar a su familia
texts.en: Dr. Isaura Esther, 30, has worked as a General Physician for  the last four years.  Her husband works as an administrator.  They are both very hardworking and share household expenses and debts incurred.  She’s asking for her third loan to buy a solar panel that will allow her to have access to electricity in the zone where she lives.  According to references, this couple is characterized by being responsible.  Her greatest wish in life is to enjoy work stability and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Elvis Misael

texts.es: Elvis está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera de Mercadeo Y Publicidad. Dentro de algunos años se ve en un puesto de trabajo estable desempeñando sus conocimientos y siendo una fuente para sacar adelante la empresa para la que trabaje. Le inspiran sus padres ya que ellos se han sacrificado para darle una buena educación. Elvis es muy responsable y le gusta mucho su carrera y sueña que será alguien que contibuirá a su país de cualquier forma.
texts.en:
Elvis is requesting a loan to pay for his final fees to register his Marketing and Publicity degree. In a few years he sees himself in a stable job using his knowledge and being a source of progress for the company he’s working for.

His parents inspire him as they have sacrificed themselves to give him a good education. Elvis is very responsible, enjoys his career and dreams that he will be someone who contributes to his country in some way.

loans.use: pay his final fees to register his degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for the final fees to register his degree.

loans.name: Jahoska Maciel

texts.es: Para Jahoska su mayor inspiración para lograr sus metas es su familia y sobre todo su hermano ya que es el que más le ha apoyado en esta etapa de su vida y le gustaría retribuir todo lo que él ha hecho por ella. Jahoska se encuentra en el último año de la carrera de Contabilidad Pública, y está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación. Espera trabajar en una empresa como contadora general ya que se ha esforzado mucho por concluir sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jahoska’s greatest inspiration for reaching her goals is her family and above all her brother since he’s been her greatest supporter in this phase of her life and she’d like to reciprocate everything he’s done for her.

Jahoska is in the last year of Public Accounting and is asking for the loan to pay for her final course.  She hopes to work as a general accountant for a firm since she’s worked very hard to complete her studies.

loans.use: to pay fees.

loans.name: Bertilda Armanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Armanda. Tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa, además de dos nietos de 10 y 9 años de edad que son como que si fueran de ella y estudian en escuela. Su esposo  es comerciante.

Ella junto a sus esposo desde hace mas de 15 años tienen una pequeña panadería la cual es muy visitada por sus clientes que desde la madrugada comprar el delicioso pan indispensable en la mesa de los ciudadanos, ella también prepara deliciosos pasteles los mismos que decora de acuerdo a la ocasión que sus clientes deseen. Allí también venden gaseosas, café y ciertos productos de primera necesidad. Trabajan junto a su esposo y sus hijos  todos los días desde las  5h00 hasta la noche que se encargan de dejar todo listo para el nuevo día.

Este crédito es para comprar harina, sal, manteca, azúcar y otros víveres necesarios para la fabricación del pan y sus pasteles. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido mejorando su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son aumentar más su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “San Esteban” (St. Stephen) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes away from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Armanda, 58, lives in this place.  She’s married and has five children who are all now adults.  Two of them still live at home as well as two grandchildren who are 10 and 9 years old and are as if they were her own; they attend school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have had a small bakery for more than 15 years which is much visited by customers as early as dawn to buy delicious bread that’s indispensable at citizens’ tables.  She also makes delicious cakes that she decorates according to the occasion her customers desire.  They also sell soft-drinks, coffee and certain basic staple items there. She works alongside her husband and children every day from 5am until evening when they leave everything ready for the next day.

This loan is to buy flour, salt, shortening, sugar and other foodstuffs needed to prepare the bread and her cakes.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because she’s been able to improve the business with the loans.  Her dreams are to increase the business more and to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, shortening, sugar and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jesica Irene

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Irene, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 6 y 5 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
p> 
Ella desde hace mas de 8 años y con lo poco que tenia decidió adecuar un local en su casa en el mismo que surtió una  pequeña tienda de comestibles, en la actualidad además de víveres también vende ciertos artículos de bazar, papelería y  medicamentos permitidos, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, allí además de ganarse el sustento de su familia también está al tanto de su hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos que requieren de muchos cuidados.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, carne, azúcar, aceite y varios productos más para surtir su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de tres años y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Su sueño es tener la mejor tienda de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The “San Esteban” (St. Stephen) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes away from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Irene, 30, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 6 and 5 years old; both attend school.  Her husband is a farmer.

A little over 8 years ago and with the little she had she decided to set up a grocery store at home that she stocked with foodstuffs.  At present, in addition to food items she also sells household items, stationery supplies and permitted medicines.  She works every day from 6am until 7pm.  Besides earning her family’s sustenance there she’s also watching over her home and the needs of her children who require much care.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, sugar, oil and various other products to stock her store.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than three years and she likes it because interest rates are very low.  Her dream is to have the best store in town.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Franccis

texts.en: Franccis is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as stationery, snacks, sweets, etc. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of goods. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stationery, sweets, snacks, etc. His business goal is to venture into the vehicle transportation industry within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stationery, snacks, sweets etc

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old John.  He is married and has three children, aged 4, 7 and 12. He has two additional dependents who live with him to help in their education. In 2009, John established his auto spare parts business. He began his business to generate income and to meet his family's needs.

Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,800,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. John has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional auto spare parts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, John plans to expand to the outskirts of town and to increase his stock and profit. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for auto spare parts.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба жительница города Худжанд. Ей 37 лет. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Матлуба имеет среднее образование. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки для вышивки.
texts.en: Matluba is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She is 37 years old, divorced and has two children.  Matluba has a secondary education.  She is involved in sewing national dresses.  She has been in this type of business for eight years.  Matluba is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine for embroidery.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for embroidery

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 35 years old, single and lives in Buchanan. She stopped her education at grade 12. For the past 13 years, she has been selling charcoal in the market. She established the business from her savings. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Ибодат торгует на рынке более 10 лет. Она продает мужскую одежду. Первый свой кредит она получила в 2002 году. Сейчас она успешный предприниматель. Когда-то ее сын также как и другие ездил в Россию на заработки но дела шли не так как хотелось Ибодат. Она решила получить кредит  в большом размере и открыть еще одну точку на хорошем рынке для сына. Сейчас у них две торговые точки. Ибодат продает мелкие мужские вещи, как  головной убор и нижнее белье ,а у ее  сына более дорогая мужская одежда и хороший оборот в бизнесе. В настоящий момент она очень рада что существуют такие организации как КИВА ,что помогли ей и ее сыну найти хорошую прибыльную работу. Теперь ее сын находиться рядом с ней и со  своей семьей.
texts.en: Ibodat has been selling at a market for over ten years.  She sells men's clothing.  She obtained her first loan in 2002.  Now, Ibodat is a successful entrepreneur.  At some point, her son, just like others, went to Russia for work, but things were not going as Ibodat wanted.  She decided to obtain a large loan and open another retail outlet for her son at a good market.  Currently, they have two retail outlets.  Ibodat sells men's clothing accessories, such as hats and undergarments, and her son has more expensive men's clothing and good turnover in business.  At the present time, she is very glad that organizations like Kiva exist, and that they helped her and her son to find a good, profitable work.  Now, her son can stay near her and with his family.

loans.use: to purchase spring merchandise

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señorita Karina, tiene 25 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, junto con dos hermanos menores a quienes les ayuda para sus estudios.

Ella para obtener sus ingresos para sus gastos y también para ayudar con los estudios de sus dos hermanos menores se dedica al comercio, ella  vende ropa, zapatos y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días por las tardes, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días, lleva más de 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, ella empezó vendiendo ropa y ahora ah aumentado sus productos para la venta.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes, entre otras cosas. Lleva más de dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho para su negocio y su vida personal.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hermanos terminen sus estudios y tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "San Esteban" meets every other week in they city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture, and also because it is only several minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Señorita Karina lives.  She is 25 years old and is single.  She lives in her parents' home with her two younger brothers whom she helps with their studies.

In order to earn income for her expenses, and also to be able to help with the education costs of her two younger brothers, Karina works in retail.  She sells clothing, shoes, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  Her sales method is going door-to-door, and she works every day in the afternoon.  She provides credit for her customers, and collects payment every two weeks.  She has been in this business for more than seven years, and it has been going very well for her.  She began by selling clothing, and has now increased the products that she sells.

This new loan is to purchase clothing, shoes, creams, and perfumes, among other things.  She has been part of the Communal Bank for more than two years, and likes it because the loans have helped her greatly in her business and personal life.

Her dreams are for her brothers to complete their studies, and to have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Corazón De Santa María Group

texts.es: La Sra. María de 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos los cuales son independientes. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, detergentes, etc. desde hace 8 años. Comenzó con la venta de golosinas y refrescos con la idea de lograr abrir su propio negocio. También se dedica al servicio de costura desde hace 6 meses. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de agua, luz y teléfono; mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación. Su plan para el futuro es abrir un restaurante en su propia casa. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. María pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Corazón de Santa María”, grupo que se acaba de formar y está conformado por 6 personas. Le pusieron dicho nombre debido a que la zona en donde viven lleva el nombre de “Santa María”.
texts.en:
María, 42, has a spouse and three independent children.  She has been selling groceries like rice, sugar, soft-drinks, detergent, etc. for the last 8 years.  She started out selling snacks and soft-drinks with the idea of opening her own business.  She’s also been providing sewing services for the last 6 months.  

She currently spends her income on water, electricity and telephone while her husband covers food costs.  Her plan for the future is to open a restaurant at home.  She used the loan to buy merchandise for her store.  

María belongs to the “Corazón de Santa María” (St. Mary’s Heart), a newly-formed group that has six members.  They gave it this name because the zone they live in is called “Santa María.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Don Mario, como lo conocen sus vecinos es de la ciudad de Santaní, Soltero, tiene hijos que aun son pequeños y quienes son la razón de ser de Mario.
El es dueño de una pequeña pero surtida despensa, que es la única del barrio, y nos comenta que todos sus vecinos acuden siempre a su negocio para poder comprar de él, y gracias a eso le va muy bien y tiene los medios necesarios para poder mantener a su familia día a día. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder dar a sus hijos una buena educación y que no tengan que pasar por las privaciones como las que él tuvo que pasar.
Solicita el crédito ya que quiere surtir su negocio con bebidas, lácteos, comestibles, embutidos, carne, hortalizas, verduras y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir surtiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Don Mario, as he’s known by his neighbors in the city of Santaní, is single and has children who are still little and who are Mario’s reason to live.

He owns a small but well stocked store that’s the only one in the neighborhood.   He tells us that all of his neighbors come by all the time to buy from him and thanks to this he does very well and has the necessary resources to support his family day to day.  His goal is to stay in business to be able to give his children a good education so that they won’t have to suffer privations like he had to.

He requests the loan because he wants to stock the store with soft-drinks, dairy products, food items, cured meats, meat, greens, vegetables and others to continue stocking his customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Tres Fronteras Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue una de las miembros  quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa de la fundacion paraguaya. Actualmente estan muy contentas dentro del programa y desean poder llegar al maximo nivel del programa.
La sra. Higina tiene un Almacen, ella quedo viuda hace varios años, y nos dice que vive con su hija y nietos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que siempre ha luchado por darle lo mejor a su familia y que no pasen por ninguna necesidad. Higinia tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azucar, bebidas, lacteos, verduras, carne y demás insumos, con lo que podrá abastacerse y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The contact person to start this committee was one of the members who invited and organized her friends to be part of Fundación Paraguaya’s program.  They are currently very happy within the program and want to reach the maximum level in the program.

Higinia has a store.  She was widowed several years ago and she tells us that she lives with her daughter and grandchildren.  She is a very hardworking, enterprising woman who has always striven to give her family the best so that they won’t go through any privations.  Higinia’s goal is to continue enlarging her store thus providing a better lifestyle for her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy sugar, soft-drinks, dairy products, vegetables, meat and other supplies to stock up to be able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft-drinks, dairy products, vegetables, meat and other supplies.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo mediante una de las integrantes quien había integrado parte de otro comité que se disolvió. Actualmente ella se mudo, e invito a sus vecinas y amigas a formar un nuevo grupo, de esa forma se creó el comité Las Emprendedoras.
La Sra Silvia tiene 32 años de edad está casada con el Sr Simón quien es Empleado, junto tienen 2 hijos. Ella es Comerciante, tiene una despensa, con la cual surte a sus vecinos del barrio. Nos comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio y que poco a poco con mucho sacrificio fue creciendo hasta llegar a lo que es hoy.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar, panificados, yerba, café, etc. para su negocio. Posee una meta ampliar su negocio y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by one of the members who had been part of another committee that was dissolved.  When she moved, she invited her neighbors and friends to form a new group, and in this way, she created Las Emprenedoras Committee. 
 
Silvia is 32 years old and married to Simon who is a worker.  They have two children.  She is a merchant and has a pantry from which she provides food to her neighbors in the barrio.  She says that it began as a small business and gradually, with much sacrifice, grew to become what it is today.  

She is requesting the loan to purchase baked goods, yerba mate (a popular South American herb that is brewed into a high-caffeine infusion), coffee, and other items for her business.  Her goal is to expand her business and in this way, continue helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase baked goods, yerba mate, coffee, and other items.

loans.name: Mohamed Jayah

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has three children, aged 21, 19 and 17. In 1997, Mohamed established his palm oil and local foodstuff business. He began his business to generate income and to meet his family's needs. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,150,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional palm oil and local rice. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand the shop from a makeshift store to a concrete building. The loan can increase his profit margin and make him sustainable. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for palm oil and local foodstuff.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 27 years old. He lives in a small village of Akhalkalaki District, South Georgia with his parents, a sister, and a brother. Zaza is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of their income. His father works as a postman in the village and his mother is a housewife; his brother and sister are students. 

Zaza runs a family dairy farm with four milk cows and seven calves. He produces cheese and sells it in his and nearby villages. The family also owns 40 beehives with bee colonies. Zaza harvests honey two times a year and sells it in his and nearby villages as well. The family owns one hectare of land, where potatoes are grown. Zaza works hard during the whole year in the family farm with family members helping him. 

Zaza is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase potatoes for sowing. He will purchase good quality potatoes and receive a good harvest in the summer. Part of the loan will be used to repair his car. Zaza uses the car for transportation of agricultural products for sale to nearby villages. At the moment, the car is out of order. After the repair, it will be functional and Zaza will be able to take products to villages again.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and to repair the car.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 34 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has four children; three are in school and all live at home. For the past four years, she has been operating a small food center where she sells Liberian dishes. She has a lot of customers and she makes a lot of money, which is helping her to look after her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil and other spices for her business. In the future, she plans to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and other spices for her business.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru: Мукадас занимается выращиванием овощей. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Она замужем. Ей 25 лет. У нее трое детей. Ее муж помогает ей в продвижении деятельности. Она берет кредит для закупа семян картошки и пшеницы.
texts.en: Mukadas is involved in growing vegetables.  She has been in this business for six years.  She is 25 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband helps her with running this business.  Mukadas is requesting this loan to buy potato and wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy potato and wheat seeds

loans.name: Virgen De Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
El comité  lleva por nombre “Virgen de Santa Ines”. Las integrantes agradecen la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación  Paraguaya,  ya que así tendrán nuevas oportunidades  para emprender un mejor trabajo. Se encuentra en el Segundo Ciclo con 14 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son  unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
Maria pertenece a este grupo y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas, ropas, y también productos Avon. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y no pierde su tiempo, es por ello que se dedica a varias cosas, con lo cual puede ayudar a su familia a cubrir el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas, como ser bananas, naranjas, manzanas y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir vendiendo y teniendo buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee is called “Virgen de Santa Inés.”  The members are grateful for the opportunity Fundación Paraguaya is giving them since they will thus have new opportunities to start better work.  

They are in the second cycle with 14 members each with her respective productive activity.  They are united and mutually supportive.

María belongs to this group and she tells us that she sells fruit, clothes and also Avon products.  She is a very hardworking person who does not waste time which is why she does so many different things in order to help her family cover daily needs.

She asked for the loan to buy fruit like bananas, oranges, apples and others to continue selling and have a good variety available for her customers.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, apples and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for provisions

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба не замужем, живет с родителями. Она помогает отцу развивать скот. Так как все братья женились и уехали из дому, ей  одной с отцом пришлось заниматься откормом скота. Ее отец также имеет 2 гектара земли , где они выращивают арахис. От продажи скота они смогут арендовать еще несколько гектаров земли и посадить бахчевые культуры, как арбуз и дыни. К Махбубе сватаются молодые люди, и ее родители хотят выдать ее замуж, так она планируют после развития бизнеса и полученной прибыли пополнить своё приданное как раз к своей свадьбе. Это ее первый кредит, который она получила для покупки коз и  хоть как то помочь своему  отцу.
texts.en: Mahbuba is not married and lives with her parents.  She helps her father to breed livestock.  Because all of her brothers got married and left home, she was the only one left to be involved in fattening up livestock with her father.  Her father also has two hectares of land, where they grow peanuts.  Sales of livestock would enable them to lease several more hectares and plant melon crops, such as watermelons and cantaloupe.  Because Mahbuba is being courted by young men, and her parents want to marry her off, she plans to develop the business and earn a profit, so that she can add to her dowry right in-time for her wedding.  This is her first loan, which she obtained to purchase goats and to somehow help her father.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Хуршед музыкант. Он работает в филармонии. В этой области работает 8 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения музыкального (клавишный) инструмента.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 33 years old, married and has three children.  Khurshed is a musician.  He works at a philharmony.  He has been working in this field for eight years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a musical instrument (keyboard).

loans.use: to purchase a musical instrument

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora es de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son 10 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad que se han unido con el propósito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras y salir adelante.
Matilde es la presidenta del grupo y nos comenta que ella trabaja siempre arduamente para poder ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Matilde tiene una carnicería y gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes de carne, con lo que podrá abastecerse y de esa forma siempre tener este producto para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” committee is from the city of Santaní.  They are ten women who are friends and neighbors from this city who have joined together with the aim of working together and through this work help each other get ahead.

Matilde is group president and she comments that she’s always worked hard to be able to help her family and to give them everything they need so that they would not have to go through any of the privations she had to go through.  Matilde has a butcher shop and thanks to her work and effort it’s making progress.

She asks for the loan to buy cuts of meat to stock up on so that she will always have the product available to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cuts of meat to sell.

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “El Manantial”  están en el  Décimo Segundo Ciclo, con 24 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables las unas con las otras. Las mismas tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores juntas para poder apoyarse.
Sonia es una de las miembros del grupo, y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de perfumes de toda clase. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido salir adelante e ir mejorando sus ingresos día a día. Comenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella los perfumes que vende, y gracias a esos ingresos puede ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes, tanto como para hombres como para mujeres, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ofreciendo mayor variedad a sus clientes. Sonia, como sus compañeras están agradecidas por la oportunidad de progreso que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee is called “El Manantial” (The Spring) and they are in their 12th cycle with 24 members.  It’s a group that stands out in the neighborhood because they are very united, mutually supportive and responsible with each other.  They have a great enterprising spirit since they carry out joint projects in order to support themselves.

Sonia is one of the members of the group and she comments that she sells all kinds of perfume.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she’s succeeded in getting ahead and gradually improve her income day to day.  She comments that she does very well because she has a very good clientele who always buys the perfume she sells and thanks to that income she’s able to help her family.

She requested the loan to buy perfume both for men and for women to continue working and offering a wider selection to her customers.  Sonia, like her fellow members, is grateful for the opportunity for success they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy perfume to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Kadiatu, a married mother of two children aged 8 and 13. She has two additional dependents who live with her to assist a sister with her children's education. In 2004, Kadiatu established her house decoration business out of the need to improve her family's living conditions. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month.

Having already received and repaid three loans, Kadiatu is requesting a new one in the amount of Le 5,000,000 to buy additional picture frames, flowers, mats, carpets and rugs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to establish an outlet in the township. Currently located in a stall, the business is slow when it rains. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for picture frames, flowers, mats, carpets and rugs.

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Ousseynou est un jeune chauffeur  de camion dans une entreprise de la place. En même temps il s’active dans l’élevage  de poulets de chair ou il a acquis une expérience de 7 ans. Ousseynou est  célibataire sans  enfants.
Il est à son second prêt à  l’IMCEC  et avec l’argent, qu’il demande, il va acheter  3 caisses de poussins, des vaccins et de l’aliment volaille.
Bien qu’étant  célibataire, cela ne l’empêche pas de participer à la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Ousseynou tend à diversifier les produits et services et à améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille et cela avec l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousseynou is a young truck driver working for a local business. At the same time, he raises broiler chickens, a line of work he has been doing for seven years. Ousseynou is single, without children.

He is on his second loan with IMCEC. With the funds requested he will buy three cases of chickens as well as chicken feed and vaccinations. Although he is single, he helps support his relatives. With the support of lenders, Ousseynou tries to diversify the products and services and improve the nutrition of his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and resell.

loans.name: Muhtaram

texts.ru: Мухтарам замужняя женщина, она имеет 5 детей. У нее 4 дочерей и один сын.Дочки замужем а ее  единственный сын находиться с ней и помогает ей в бизнесе. Сын Мухтарам начинающий ювелир, он учиться у частного ювелира чтобы помочь матери в развитии бизнеса. Она раньше получала кредит для потребительских нужд, ремонта дома, проведения свадеб и на ремонт машины.Теперь она получает кредит для увеличение товарооборота, ее сын изготовил несколько ювелирных изделий, чтобы продолжит реализацию. Она рада, что  может получить финансовую поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en: Muhtaram is a married woman with five children.  She has four daughters and one son.  Her daughters are married, and her only son is with her and helps her with the business.  Muhtaram's son is beginner jeweler, who is studying with a private jeweler in order to help his mother with developing the business.  Muhtaram previously obtained loans for consumer needs, house repairs, holding weddings and car repairs.  Now, she is obtaining a loan to increase goods turnover, and her son made several jewelry items in order to continue sales.  She is glad that she can receive financial support from Kiva.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Imonali

texts.ru: Имонали мужчина 36 лет, женат, имеет 3 детей. Его основной работой является  откармливание скота. Но также у него есть земля, где он выращивает овощи. Каждый раз когда он покупает и  продает скот, на полученную прибыль он  приобретает семена овощей  и  сажает.  В этот раз у него есть заказ на саженцев огурцов и помидоров. Он планирует на полученный кредит купить еще теленка, а когда настанет время продавать , он продаст уже корову. Он живет с матерью и детьми, а его жена находиться в России на заработках. В их селе принято, чтобы младший сын жил с родителями, поэтому он начал постройку  дома, чтобы в будущем его сыновья не нуждались и были обеспечены домом.
texts.en: Imonali is a 36 year-old married man with three children.  His primary work is fattening up livestock.  He also has land, where he grows vegetables.  Every time he buys and sells livestock, he uses the resulting profit to buy vegetable seeds and plants them.  This time, he has an order for cucumber and tomato seedlings.  Imonali plans to use this loan to buy another calf, and when the time comes to sell, he would sell a cow.  He lives with his mother and children, and his wife is working in Russia.  It is customary in their village that the youngest son lives with his parents, and this is why he started to build a house to ensure that his sons would not be in need and be provided with a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase and resell livestock

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo es separado su esposa lo dejo con su pequeña hija de tan solo 4 años juntos  vive en el barrio Guapuru 2 de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  trabaja en su carpintería haciendo puertas y  marcos de ventana  y otros trabajos en general.
 El destino del  préstamo es para la compra de madera , ya que quiere aumentar su cantidad de madera para poder producir un poco más y  de esa manera mejorar la calidad de vida que llevan él y su pequeña hija, El señor Jun nos cuenta que trabaja todos los días en compañía  de su hija  en el taller de carpintería.
Este material que le hace falta  no la puede  comprar ya que sus ingresos son muy justos  para sus gastos  diarios y por este motivo el no dispone de dinero inmediato, pues se le presentó la oportunidad de comparar la madera al por mayor y a un precio muy bajo, esto le servirá mucho ya que tendrá material acumulado para trabajar.
 
 Entre sus sueños y metas, es ver a su hija en futuro con una carrera profesional para que de esta forma pueda tener un mejor nivel de vida, y ampliar su pequeña carpintería
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is separated.  His wife left him with his little daughter, only four years old.  They live together in the Guapuru 2 neighborhood in the city of Santa Cruz.  He works in his carpentry workshop making doors, window frames, and other jobs in general.

The purpose of the loan is to buy wood, because he wants to increase the quantity of wood to be able to produce a little more.  In this way he will improve the quality of life for himself and his young daughter.  Juan tells us that he works every day with his daughter in his carpentry workshop.

He cannot buy this material he needs because his income is just right for his daily expenses.  For this reason he does not have the money right now.  The opportunity came up to buy wood wholesale at a low price.  This will be a big help to him because he will have accumulated material for work.

Among his dreams and goals are seeing his daughter in the future with a professional career so she can have a better standard of living, and expanding his small carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Las Milagrosas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité la milagrosa es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, está integrado por 17 mujeres quienes son todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas han visto una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de la fundación, y es por ello que se han unido, para mejorar las condiciones de sus familias.
Andresa es una de las integrantes del grupo, y nos comenta que ella se dedica a la venta de carbón, con lo cual puede tener los medios para ayudar a su familia. Comenta que le va bien en las ventas, ya que el carbón últimamente es muy solicitado pues es más barato.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma tener más de este producto en su stock.
texts.en:
This committee (La Milagrosa) is from the town of Villa Elisa.  It has 17 members who are all women.  They are all friends and neighbors from the same town.  They have seen in Fundación Paraguaya's program a great opportunity to make progress and so they have come together in order to improve their families' well-being.

Andresa is one of the members of this group.  She tells us that her business is selling charcoal and it makes her the income she needs to help her family.  She says that her sales are going very well as charcoal is very much in demand lately because it is cheaper.

Andresa is requesting this loan to buy charcoal so that she can stock up.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elias Ramon

texts.es:
ELIAS RAMON, de 31 años de edad,  es soltero,   vive con el hermano, en el Recinto Rancho Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, no tiene hijos.

La VRC  Bendición de Dios se   encuentra ubicada en el Recinto  Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche a  45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

ELIAS RAMON se dedica a la agricultura,a la siembra de maíz y cebada.Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos, insumos, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos y mejorar los cultivos.

Las compras y ventas las ejecuta en  Ventanas de manera  semanal. El sueño es incrementar la producción  y poder seguir trabajando. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  son las plagas que se presentan en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, y visitar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Elias Ramón is 31 years old, single, and lives with his brother in Rancho Grande, in Ventanas canton.  He does not have any children.

The 'Bendición de Dios' (God's Blessing) community bank is located in Rancho Grande, in Puerto Pechiche parish, 45 minutes from the office.  It has 11 members.

Elias Ramón is a farmer who grows corn and barley.  He is requesting this loan to buy urea, fertilizers, organic manure, supplies and insecticides.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and improve his crops.

Elias Ramon makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas every week.  His dream is to increase his production and continue working.  the challenges he faces in his business are pests which appear on his crops.  In his free time, he enjoys relaxing and checking on his crops.

loans.use: to buy urea, fertilizers, organic manure, supplies and insecticides

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Benjamin, a married father of four children aged 2, 5, 10 and 14 years. He has three additional dependents who live with him as he helps his sister with her children's education. In 2005, in order to become self-reliant, Benjamin established his patient drugs business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 each month.

Having received and repaid two previous loans, Benjamin is requesting a new one in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to increase his stock, and hopes that it will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Benjamin plans to develop his shop from a patient store to a pharmacy and employ workers. The loan will be helpful to him and his family, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various goods for resale.

loans.name: Kalbu

texts.ru:
Калбу 63 года, замужем, воспитала 4  детей. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, Калбу с 2010 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости,  в хозяйстве Калбу на сегодняшний  день имеется  7 дойных коров, 2 нетели, 4 лошади и 83 овцы.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калбу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп лошади и коровы с теленком.  Доходы от кредита Калбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Kalbu is 63 years old, married and raised four children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry since 2010 to provide a source of income for her family.  Thanks to her hard work and persistence, today Kalbu's business contains 7 dairy cows, 2 heifers, 4 horses and 83 sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Kalbu requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a horse and a cow with a calf.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
CESAR ENRIQUE, tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, tiene 8 hijos de las edades de 28, 25,23,21,19,18,15 y de 3 años ,  vive con su esposa e hijos  en  el Recinto Rancho Grande, del cantón Ventanas, provincia de Los Ríos.

La VRC  Bendición de Dios se   encuentra ubicada en el Recinto  Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche a  45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

CESAR ENRIQUE  se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, urea, insecticidas, lìquidos mata montes,  Con la ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir  los abonos necesarios para los cultivos.
 
Las compras las realiza de manera semanal en Ventanas y ventas de acuerdo a la cosecha en la misma ciudad.

El sueño es  prosperar   en sus tierras con incremento de productos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta  es  la mala semilla que a veces les venden en ápoca de siembras.

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar en su hamaca y visitar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Cesar Enrique is 53 years old, married, and has eight children who are 28, 25, 23, 21, 19, 18, 15 and 3 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in Rancho Grande, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Bendición de Dios' (God's Blessing) community bank is located in Rancho Grande, in Puerto Pechiche parish, 45 minutes from the office.  It has 11 members.

Cesar Enrique is a farmer who grows rice and corn.  He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers, urea, insecticides and weed-killing liquids.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the fertilizers he needs for his crops.

Cesar Enrique makes his purchases every week in Ventanas and makes his sales according to his harvests in the same city.  His dream is to prosper in his business and increase his produce.  The challenge that he faces is bad seed that people sometimes sell during the sowing season.

In his free time, Cesar Enrique enjoys relaxing in his hammock and checking on his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, insecticides and weed-killing liquids

loans.name: Mirian Jahaira

texts.es:
MIRIAN JAHAIRA, tiene 18 años de edad, de estado civil soltera,  vive con sus padres,  en  el Recinto Rancho Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, no tiene hijos.

La VRC  Bendición de Dios se   encuentra ubicada en el Recinto  Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche a  45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

MIRIAN JAHAIRA  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y  maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar  fertilizantes, urea, lìquidos mata maleza, abono orgánico. 

Con la yuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y el lìquidos que le ayudará de mucho para mantener sano los cultivos.

Las compras y ventas las realizan en  Ventanas de manera  semanal. Su  sueño es comprarse un terreno y culminar sus estudios.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  son las plagas que se presentan en los cultivos cómo el cogollero.
En su tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Mirian Jahaira is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents in Rancho Grande, in Ventanas canton.  She does not have any children.

The 'Bendición de Dios' (God's Blessing) community bank is located in Rancho Grande, in Puerto Pechiche parish, 45 minutes from the office.  It has 11 members.

Mirian Jahaira is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, urea, weed-killing liquids and organic manure.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy fertilizers and liquids which will help her a lot in keeping her crops healthy.

Mirian Jahaira makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas every week.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land and to finish her studies.  The challenge that she faces are the pests that appear on her crops such as the maize budworm.

In her free time, Mirian Jahaira enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, weed-killing liquids and organic manure

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru:
Гулсаре 45 лет, замужем, имеет 5 сыновей. Гулсара работает преподавателем истории в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 30,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Гулсара смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 13,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря прибыли от хозяйства, Гулсара оплачивает обучение своих детей в университете. Также Гулсара занимается изготовлением национальных изделий, таких как курак (одеяла, матрасы), сайма (вышивка), что служит дополнительным доходом для ее семьи. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулсара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Гулсара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulsara is 45 years old, married and has five sons. She works as a history teacher at a local school and is involved in in animal husbandry to provide an additional source of income. She started this business with an amount of 30,000 som (KGS), and, thanks to her hard work and persistence, Gulsara was able to develop her business to have a monthly profit of 13,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to the business profits, she is able to pay for her children's education in a university.  Gulsara is also involved in making national goods, such as kurak (blankets, mattresses), sayma (embroidery), which serves as an additional source of income for her family.  In order to further develop her business, Gulsara requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Muna

texts.en: Muna is 38 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has six children between the ages of 11 and 28; all of them attend school. For the past 19 years she has been selling palm oil in the market, a business she started with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil for her business. She plans to build a house and warehouse.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil for her business

loans.name: Matilde Florentino

texts.es:
Matilde Florentino es un ciudadano de 62 años de edad vive con su familia, en la comunidad de Canalette, en la región de Upala, San Carlos en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta provincia ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas, una de las principales zonas ganaderas del país especialmente a través de la producción del cantón de San Carlos. Además en la provincia se asientan las plantas procesadoras de leche de la Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, propiedad de miles de productores de leche. Además en la zona alrededor de la ciudad de Alajuela se ha asentado gran cantidad de empresas manufactureras de exportación. En Alajuela operan las zonas francas de El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos y Bet. 

Don Matilde Florentino se dedica a trabajos de campo pero no le es suficiente para cumplir su sueño que es el de darle una vivienda digna a su familia, para ello necesita apoyo financiero para comprar los  materiales de construcción  y pagar la mano de obra .

Actualmente Matilde Florentino está solicitando un micro crédito de un millón cincuenta mil colones (¢1.050.000), con esto lograría darle una vivienda digna a su familia y de igual forma viviría más cómodamente. 
Matilde Florentino es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Matilde Florentino is 62 years old and lives with his family in Canalette, located within the Upala, San Carlos region, in the Alajuela province.  This province produces the highest amounts of coffee and cane sugar in the country.  It also produces basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruits, vegetables, tubers, and flowers.  It’s also one of the country’s main producers of livestock, especially within the San Carlos settlement.  Besides that, the “Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos” cooperative milk producing plants are located within the province.  The co-op is the property of thousands of milk producers.  Many export manufacturers have also located within the zone around the city of Alajuela.  The El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos, and Bet zones are also located around the city.

Matilde Florentino works in the fields, but it not enough so that he can achieve his dream of providing a dignified home for his family.  For this he needs financial support to buy building materials and pay for labor.

Matilde Florentino is asking for a micro loan of 1,050,000 colones ($2,100) so that he can provide a dignified home for his family and so that they will live more comfortably.

Matilde Florentino is a partner in the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette company, one of the more that 150 EDESA social organizations in Costa Rica.  He expects to be able to continue growing personally and financially with the help of this loan, and to be able to actively participate in the credit organization in his community.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lourdes Rocio

texts.es:
LOURDES ROCIO, tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil unión libre, vive con  reside en el Recinto Rancho Grande, del cantón Ventanas, provincia de Los Ríos, tiene seis  hijos  y vive con ellos.

La VRC  Bendición de Dios se   encuentra ubicada en el Recinto  Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche a  45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

LOURDES ROCIO  se dedica  a la agricultura, siembra maíz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de urea, fertilizantes, lìquidos para la maleza, insecticidas y así poder mejorar el cultivo. Las compras las realiza hace de forma semanal en Ventanas y las ventas al finalizar el ciclo de cultivo  en la misma ciudad.

Su sueño es  comprar un terreno propio  y así  cultivar los productos propios de la zona, los desafíos a los que se enfrenta  las plagas que afectan  a los cultivos.

Su tiempo libre lo dedica al arreglo de la casa.
texts.en:
Lourdes Rocío is 40 years old and lives in a common-law relationship.  She lives in the precinct of Rancho Grande in Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos.  She has six children and lives with them.

Bendición de Dios Communal Bank is located in the Rancho Grande precinct of the parish of Puerto Pechiche, 45 minutes from our office, and is made up of 11 members.

Lourdes Rocío works in agriculture growing corn.  She is requesting the loan to buy urea, fertilizer, liquid herbicide for the pests, and insecticide to be able to improve the crop.  She makes her purchases weekly in Ventanas and sells in the same city when the growing season is over.

Her dream is to buy her own property to grow products native to the area.  The challenges she faces are the pests that affect the crops.

She spends her free time fixing up the house.

loans.use: to buy urea, fertilizer, liquid herbicide for pests, and insecticide.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Daniel, a married father of two children aged six and four. He has two additional dependents who live with him to help his wife with the household chores and in the business. In 2002, Daniel established his cooking utensils business to generate income and to meet his family's needs. Working six days a week and nne hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month.

Having already received and repaid three loans, Daniel is requesting a new one in the amount of Le 5,000,000 to buy additional dishes, bowls and cups. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Daniel plans to build another house with the profits arising from the loan and also establish an outlet for his wife to operate. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bowls, dishes, and glass cups for his business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 39 years old and lives in Buchanan, Liberia.  She is divorced and has 4 children between the ages of 14 and 19, all of them are in school and live at home.  For the past 15 years she has been selling used clothes, she started this business from her husband savings.  She likes her business because always keep her with money, and she is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business.  She plans to expand her house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: This is 44 year-old Hassan.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 20 and 14. In 1992, Hassan established his men's wear business. He began his business because he wants to reach the peak of his family needs. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,350,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hassan has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional jeans shirts and polos. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Hassan plans to complete his building project and to own a shop.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for jeans, shirts and polos

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: This is 43 year-old Marie.  She is married, and has 3 children aged 10, 6 and 4. She has 5 additional dependents, who live with her because to help in their schooling and to also help in the business.  In 1991, Marie established her cooking condiment business. She began her business to help the husband to take care of the house and to meet her personal needs. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Marie has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional oil, rice seasoning, maggi, tomato paste and mayonnaise. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Marie plans to own a shop, build a house and educate her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for maggi, tomato paste, cooking oil, seasoning and mayonnaise

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 41 year-old Kadiatu.  She is married, and has 4 children aged 8, 6, 4 and 2 years. She has 5 additional dependents, who live with her to help in the business and to assist them in their learning.  In 1997, Kadiatu established her cooking condiment business. She began her business because she wants to be self reliant and to meet her personal needs. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,400,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional cooking oil, bags of rice seasoning, maggi, tomato paste and bags of onions. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to increase her stock so she can have more customers, to increase her profit margin. With the loan she is assured to reach to a higher height. She thanks you for your support.
